training_organizations.name: Vermont DCF – Family Services Division Training
training_organizations.description: The Vermont Department for Children & Families (Family Services Division) provides training for all child welfare social workers and supervisors in the state. Being a small state with a centralized system, Vermont’s training is delivered by DCF staff with some assistance from contracted trainers. New workers attend a training series covering Vermont law, investigation techniques, the Family Safety Framework, and family engagement skills. Vermont also emphasizes trauma-informed practice and has incorporated trauma training into its core curriculum.

training_organizations.name: Easterseals Vermont
training_organizations.description: A nonprofit organization that contracts with Vermont DCF to provide key family support services. Easterseals VT operates programs like supervised visitation centers (where parents and children in foster care can have safe, monitored visits):contentReference[oaicite:48]{index=48}, family time coaching to improve parenting skills, and in-home family stabilization services. By using Easterseals, Vermont ensures that families have access to supportive services required by case plans (such as visitation) through a reputable NGO, helping facilitate reunification while maintaining child safety.

training_organizations.name: KidSafe Collaborative of Vermont
training_organizations.description: A non-profit coalition based in the Burlington area that coordinates efforts among various agencies and providers to prevent and respond to child abuse. KidSafe brings together local DCF staff, schools, police, and service providers to problem-solve complex cases (often via Multi-Disciplinary Team reviews) and to identify service gaps. While not a direct service provider, KidSafe’s collaborative approach supports Vermont’s CPS by improving communication and ensuring high-risk families are surrounded with the necessary resources from different community partners.

policies.TribalFoster: No, Tribes within state do not provide foster care
policies.ReportAnonymous: General public (not mandated reporters) can remain anonymous
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Medical child abuse includes factitious disorder by proxy
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes medical neglect, inadequate clothing, inadequate shelter, and malnourishment
policies.EquityStaff_Specify: Department for Children and Families Director of Race, Gender, Equity, and Inclusion
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews can be conducted but are not required
policies.Screener_OtherSpecify: Local district staff; Family Service Division Operations team staff
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Visit to the location of alleged abuse or neglect; Determination of the nature, extent, and cause of any abuse or neglect; Determination of the identity of the alleged perpetrator; Identity of other children living in child's home; Identity of other children who may be at risk
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Sufficient information to make a determination
policies.DefAge_VaryByTypeSpecify: Educational neglect applies to children age 6 through grade 6
policies.EquityStaff_OtherSpecify: Leads the department's work to address antiracism, inclusion, equity, and accessibility priorities; Promotes organizational change that focuses on training, policy, and culture; Reviews and develops formal strategic plans, trainings, policies, procedures, and practices that work towards centering equity.
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: For sexual abuse, the perpetrator can be a person responsible to care for a child or any other person, whether an adult or a minor
policies.ScreenProcess_OtherSpecify: A second person (Family Services Worker, another Family Services Supervisor, District Director, Director of Operations, Sr. Policy and Operations Manager, or Policy and Operations Manager) screens reports that are not accepted by the supervisor to determine if a report is a valid allegation.
policies.AltResp_Inelig_OtherSpecify: Malicious punishment; Child exposed to methamphetamine production; Abuse or neglect that causes serious physical injury; Abandonment (any age); Physical abuse of a child under age 3 or a non-verbal or non-ambulatory child of any age; Substantial child endangerment
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: No experience required with a master's degree; 18 months of human services casework, including at least 6 months with a child or youth services caseload where duties included direct responsibility for client intake, assessment, plan development, monitoring, service procurement, and case closure in a formal human services delivery system required with a bachelor's degree; Satisfactory completion of 12 to 18 months experience as a Family Services Worker trainee in the Department for Children and Families with no degree
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_VarySpecify: (1) Age, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, religion, national origin , color, sex, and  political beliefs or affiliations are specified for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, foster parents, kinship caregivers, and  grantees, sub-contractors, sub-grantees and business associates in connection with the performance of work required under the contracts and grants to which they are a party with the Vermont Department for Children and Families; (2) Marital status is specified for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, and  grantees, sub-contractors, sub-grantees and business associates in connection with the performance of work required under the contracts and grants to which they are a party with the Vermont Department for Children and Families
policies.InvestReq_MHEvalCases_Specify: When sought out by family services worker; To determine whether emotional maltreatment resulted in impaired psychological growth and development
policies.ScreenRiskAssess_OtherSpecify: The type of assessment or procedure is not specified
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_OtherSpecify: Grantees, sub-contractors, sub-grantees and business associates in connection with the performance of work required under the contracts and grants to which they are a party with the Vermont Department for Children and Families
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: No experience required with a master's degree; 18 months of human services casework, including at least 6 months with a child or youth services caseload where duties included direct responsibility for client intake, assessment, plan development, monitoring, service procurement, and case closure in a formal human services delivery system required with a bachelor's degree; Satisfactory completion of 12 to 18 months experience as a Family Services Worker trainee in the Department for Children and Families with no degree
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: When child has visible trauma; To determine whether emotional maltreatment resulted in impaired psychological growth and development
policies.NearFatalities_SpecificSpecify: Life-threatening cardiopulmonary dysfunction directly attributable to conditions resulting from suspected abuse or neglect as evidenced by: (a) respiratory insufficiency/failure requiring intubation and mechanical ventilation, (b) respiratory insufficiency/failure requiring medications to reverse effects of toxic ingestion, or (c) cardiac arrhythmia with or without cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR)."
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: No experience required with a master's degree; 18 months of human services casework, including at least 6 months with a child or youth services caseload where duties included direct responsibility for client intake, assessment, plan development, monitoring, service procurement, and case closure in a formal human services delivery system with a bachelor's degree; Satisfactory completion of 12 to 18 months experience as a Family Services Worker trainee in the Department for Children and Families with no degree
policies.AltResp_EligibilityMaltreatment: Only certain types of maltreatment are eligible
policies.InvestReq_PerpCrimCases_Specify: Allegations of risk of harm/sexual abuse
policies.InvestReq_PriorCPSCases_Specify: Allegations of risk of harm/sexual abuse
policies.InvestReq_ReporterCases_Specify: If it is in the best interest of the child; If interviewing is reasonable given the circumstances; If the safety of any individual will not be jeopardized
policies.ScreenReq_PriorCPSCases_Specify: If information in the report is insufficient to justify report acceptance or indicates that a family may have had previous child protection involvement
policies.AltResp_Eligibility_OtherSpecify: There are 5 factors considered when determining whether to respond with an investigation or an assessment response: (1) there is reason to believe that a child's safety will be jeopardized if parental permission cannot be obtained to interview the child, (2) the nature and severity of the abuse and extent of a child's injury, if any (for example, physical abuse and peer-to-peer sexual abuse can be accepted as an assessment instead of an investigation), (3) the alleged perpetrator's prior history of child abuse or neglect, including history of past reports, investigations or assessments, (4) to the extent known by the reporter, the alleged perpetrator's willingness and capability to accept responsibility for the conduct and engage in a plan of services, (5) any strengths and formal and informal supports and/or resources that are available or exist within the family and community, including resources and supports for people with disabilities if relevant
policies.ExtFosterCare_Criteria_OtherSpec: Contribute to the cost of services based on a sliding scale, if the youth is working
policies.InvestReq_PerpInterviewCase_Spec: Perpetrator is willing to be interviewed; Perpetrator is a minor and their parents give permission; Perpetrator is not the child's parent or caretaker or not residing in the home, and in both cases, has not been interviewed by the police in the context of a joint investigation; Perpetrator can be located; Perpetrator does not present a significant risk to the safety of the child or protective parent; Perpetrator will not be informed of the allegation due to the wishes of the youth victim and approval by the child safety manager
policies.InvestReq_PerpPriorCPSCases_Spec: Allegations of risk of harm/sexual abuse
